author: w ant
comment: I don't understand WHY you have to type in a monstrously long URL into your phone to get this to a wearable.   IF you don't have to do that....then HOW DO you get new RSS feeds into the phone to send to the wearable?    I don't see any "help" button on this app.   I'm willing to pay for this, but right now I don't see it's usefulness.  All I can get is the 3 sample feeds.    Surely... surely, you've made it easier than this.  I'm looking for the "grab RSS  feeds button' so I can go to a site and grab the URL

author: Brian Pundyke
comment: Given that the BBC news app doesn't work on my Huawei watch,  I went looking for an alternative. RSS seemed like a good approach.  Tried others which were problematic and chose this little gem. Works well on my wearable.  Love it.
title: Works well with Wear

author: AJ Albano
comment: The app is perfect and does exactly what I wanted. The only problem is I even though I have it set to sync every three hours, have to sync it manually by going on to my phone. I'm using the LG urbane watch.
title: Doesn't synch automatically

author: John R
comment: For the last time!   Really nice app but needs to work on reliability, roughly 70% of the time when opening from the notification, it just gives the error and shuts down.  Uninstalled. Sony z3 & moto 360 1st gen
title: Unfortunately wearrss has stopped working

author: Dipesh P
comment: Just bought the app bundle for android wear. Every time I try to add a feed, the app crashes. I would like a refund please. If it worked it would awesome, but it doesnt
title: App keeps crashing

author: Jason Quick
comment: I would like to see an option to dismiss news you have already read. At the moment there is no way to get back to the first article without swiping 20+ times
title: Great way to read news

author: Adrian Calma
comment: Sony xperia z ultra + Sony smartwatch 3: when I click on read later the app crashes.  otherwise cool as I can set my own news feed on the smartwatch
title: Read later crashes

author: Mihai Radu Ionescu
comment: If you fancy reading headlines on your androidwear this is what you are looking for. Does exactly what it says, and does it well. Only caveat is that maybe once in 5 times it force closes on opening, but works flawless afterwards. I will not remove a star for this.
title: Does just what it says on the tin

author: My 2bar
comment: Only works on the watch, when I select to read the rest on the phone it crashes, so kind of useless unless you want to read a few sentences only?:-( Disappointed
title: Crashes when selecting to view on phone.

author: Bob
comment: This app turned out to be exactly as awesome as I hoped it would be. Gives you enough text of the article to let you decide if it's one you're interested in reading in full on your phone at a later time. It's great to get a heads up and stay connected with what you're interested in on the go. Additionally, the developer was very quick and detailed with a response to me regarding an issue I was facing. Always great to see devs that actually care what people think of their app. Pocket support is awesome!!
title: Perfect!

author: Arran Jenks
comment: Every time I try to add a feed the app closes and doesnt respond.
title: Doesn't work

author: Aviv Chacham
comment: I love the concept. But the app crushes when adding rss so I can't get to use it

author: Fu Sion
comment: "Unfortunately WearRSS has stopped" my Huawei watch says about 60% of the time
title: Great app but hangs most of the time

author: Jack Nam
comment: With the latest version it became impossible to read cyrillic... Any clue on it?
title: Good one, but

author: Lex Leonard
comment: Must use a link to an actual file. Some rss feeds don't make that public (Slashdot for example)

author: Krissy Tackaberry
comment: Does not sync automatically. And have to add sources by copying and letting the app add it, or the app crashes.

author: Pierre-Yves B.
comment: Multiple crashes with different news feeds.
title: Keeps on crashing

author: Mc-Shane Shinners
comment: Fitness wrist watch made life easier and better
title: Wanka

comment: Not supporting Hebrew language

author: Les Uys
comment: Works great, but crashes when I choose read later.
title: Nice

author: Itay Raz
comment: Not working

author: Fran Nostrame
comment: Great for feed reader fans

author: Afroza Ayez
comment: I like it
title: Sweet

author: Reha Hasan
comment: REHASASAN

author: David Belligoi
comment: Great app

author: Nrseife S
comment: Some of my favorite rss feeds have the extension rss.xxx.yyy/name.xml. Does not seem to work....Would be great if those are supported in a future release. Even better, add the possibility to sync with feedly.

reply.author: {creative:drewy}
reply.content: Hi, could you send me the URLs of the feeds that are giving you a problem? I'd love to try and fix the issue!

title: xml not supported?

author: Chris Andersson
comment: But I'd pay to get rid of the advertisement.   Would it be possible to read the full article on the watch unlike reading them on the phone and would it be possible to view pictures related to the headlines on the watch?
title: Great app!

comment: When I try to open the app on my moto360 it just says "unfortunately wearss has stopped".

reply.author: {creative:drewy}
reply.content: I'm guessing one of your feeds is causing an error. Can you email me the RSS feeds you are following?

title: Seems good, but won't work

author: Dwaine Adkins
comment: With the addition of the read later and long press to close options, this app is now perfect! Thanks for a great addition to my watch! Love it!
title: Prefect!

author: Tim Crawford
comment: 5 stars when I can kill the adds.
title: Where is the pro version

author: Warren Harding
comment: This app is good, but it isn't showing up on my watch

reply.author: {creative:drewy}
reply.content: Hi Warren, can you try uninstalling and reinstalling from the Play Store? It seems sometimes the wearable side of the app doesn't make it to people's watches. Uninstalling and reinstalling usually fixes it.

author: Radu Bogdan Cristian
comment: zero
title: varza

author: Angus Wills
comment: Flop

author: Ryan Helmer
comment: It needs the ability to be able to open the full article on the phone. Most things are just cut off mid sentence with no way to continue reading the article. Update: Dev says this is coming in the next update, looking forward to that!
title: Good app, needs update.

author: Tee Isme
comment: Works well on LG G watch. No problem adding feeds, since I actually looked at the name of the app I was downloading & realized that I would need sites' RSS feeds, instead of installing without reading anything and rating 1 star because I'm a doofus who downloads RSS readers without knowing what a RSS is, makes no attempt to learn by looking @ the help tab or Googling it, and instead gets mad that the RSS reader won't let me add regular non-RSS URL's (Yeah I'm looking at you, Bill)
title: Nice app

author: EDD Probe
comment: Good work, basically the only RSS reader I use. Android Authority referred me here, so thank them! Update: would like to see ability to read the entire feed on the watch (perhaps phone app setting)  or at least the ability to open the feed from the watch, on the phone with your Internet browser/rss reader. Yes, I know it was only intended for headlines, but still I would like this feature.

reply.author: {creative:drewy}
reply.content: The Read List is here! Send articles from your watch to the phone to read later!

title: Well done

author: Jason Priest
comment: I missed having RSS feeds since moving to AW from Pebble. Thank you so much. I really like how the full articles are changed by swiping across the screen. I find your app very easy to use. Good work!

reply.author: {creative:drewy}
reply.content: Thanks so much. I hope the app has continued to be useful to you!

author: Samuel Bates
comment: Neat app with a unique spin on viewing news/ rss feeds... The icon is very cleaver too.
title: Clever name and icon

author: Bill Mitchell
comment: No matter what source I typed in it would not add the lead.  Do I need to know the exact address of the feed for this to work?  Can't it look things up based upon the .com address?

reply.author: {creative:drewy}
reply.content: Hi Bill, yes, right now you need to paste or type in specific RSS urls for it to work. Unfortunately there is no one way that sites publish RSS urls. There are many different url types & many sites have multiple feeds. Would it be helpful if I wrote a blog post about getting urls into the app? Is there anything I can do to earn a better rating?

title: Can't add news feeds

author: Megan Hartman
comment: Excellent App
